name: Villa Rhapsody

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: VR is THE place to stay to chill out and enjoy the tranquility of the Kaya Valley.
reviews.title: Lovely place, Wonderful hosts

reviews.text: Atilla and Jeanne are such wonderful hosts. On arrival, we were served a welcome tea and cake. As we don't drive, Atilla gave us a lift to the otogar on his way to town when we were leaving.
reviews.title: A very lovely hotel

reviews.text: Having breakfast and dinner by the pool in the beautiful garden is one of the things we enjoyed very much. In fact, the food served at dinner is one the best we had during our trip.
reviews.title: Never had better service anywhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed chatting with Atilla and Jeanne as well as their lovely daughter, Lara. We felt we were staying with friends and not just at a pension.
reviews.title: Wonderful Villa Rhapsody

reviews.text: Our only regret is that our stay is too short. If we were to visit Turkey again, we will definitely stay at VR, for a much longer period this time.
reviews.title: Warm welcome and tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In early June, we stayed at Oludeniz and was so disappointed at how commercialised, touristy and spoilt it had become. Later on in our trip, we had to spend a night to break the journey from Kas to Selcuk and we definitely did not want to go back to Oludeniz.
reviews.title: Rural Tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So we asked Ahmet and Marie at the Hideaway in Kas if they would recommend a place to stay at Fethiye. Just as well, we asked or we would not have ended up at this most exquisite place in Kayakoy, oh..., the ever so tranquil Villa Rhapsody.
reviews.title: Quite probably paradise!

reviews.text: They told us Atilla and Jeanne would look after us. Did they ever!
reviews.title: Fantastic location, people and hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Atilla was this bundle of energy and exuberance, exuding so much goodwill. He picked us up at the otogar in Fethiye, took the long route to Kayakoy to show us the Fethiye harbour and sights.
reviews.title: Friendly Hosts, Lovely Hotel, Wonderful Location....

likes.liked: — Friendly hosts, nice rooms, lovely setting

reviews.title: My Review
reviews.text: But the most pleasant surprise for me was to meet Jeanne, who happened to be THE Villa Rhapsody herself, the self-confesssed Istanbul expert who helped me heaps when planning this trip, as I am sure she had helped thousands of TA readers plan their holidays with her thousands of postings. You are a Legend, Jeanne!

This hotel is definitely off the beaten track but when you arrive, you feel as if you have just discovered a diamond at the end of a dirt road. Jeanne and Atilla could not be warmer and more accommodating. They were quick to welcome us, help us plan excursions in the area and even provide us with the beach towels and suntan lotion we lacked. A highlight of our stay was the outstanding meals we consumed in the evening by the illuminated pool while we conversed with Jeanne, Atilla, and several guests who visit Villa Rhapsody year after year. Now we know why!
reviews.title: A Rare Find

likes.liked: — The warmth and kindness of Jeanne and Atilla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very hard for me to come here and write a review...
reviews.title: It was very hard for me......

likes.liked: — The way you feel instantly at home
likes.disliked: — Dolmus (sp bus) are a bit of a pain to time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The selfish man in me really doesn't want any one else to experience this TRUE gem in case it ever gets ruined.
reviews.title: everything was possible

reviews.text: We went to stay one night but quickly booked another and if not for having a different hotel paid for we would have stayed the whole week
reviews.title: Visit Kayakoy & Villa Rhapsody!

reviews.text: The hotel is spotless with a truely beautiful garden and perfectly relaxing atmosphere.
reviews.title: Truly a Haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the Villa Rhapsody in September and had a marvelous time. If we ever return to Turkey, this would be the reason why.
reviews.title: Excellent

likes.disliked: — The villages around it were too touristy

reviews.text: The best thing is the hosts. They are both charming and helpful. Ever ready to answer your questions and give you tips. Breakfast was very good but was easily beaten but the excellent dinner. We do indeed recommend having dinner on the site, sometimes you even get to pick what is served!
reviews.title: Simply the Best (A magical find)

likes.liked: — Every thing to much to mention

reviews.text: There is both a computer for public use as well as wifi.
reviews.title: Feeling like in a little paradies

reviews.text: The only two minuses we can think of were that the rooms themselves were a bit worn and would have benefited from more decoration. However, this is not the kind of hotel were you spend your days in the room. Second is that though the hotel is far from the hotel areas it is still a very touristy part of Turkey. The neighboring village is full of tourists and nothing else.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

likes.liked: — The hospitality of Jeanne and Atilla

reviews.text: They have cats and a dog running around adding to the charm of the hotel. The pool is nice but as said before; the hospitality is what makes this a great place. All in all we are very happy to recommend this place!
reviews.title: a hidden gem

description: Villa Rhapsody is located in the beautiful rural Kaya Valley, surrounded by mountains of the Fethiye peninsula. The perfect location for those who want to be away from the crowds, though still within easy reach of Fethiye and Ã–ldeniz beach. And we can guide you to more secluded places as well!
